intro: Notholaena inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of eastern Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Notholaena inaequalis typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various forms of wildlife.
